description.value:
The marid makes two trident attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The marid magically shoots water in a 60-foot &Reference[line]{line} that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that &Reference[line]{line} must make a [[/save dex 16 format=long]]. On a failure, a target takes [[/damage 6d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from the marid and knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. On a success, a target takes half the &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. The marid can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

&Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Demise. If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into a burst of water and foam, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. The marid’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: create or destroy water, detect evil and good, detect magic, fog cloud, purify food and drink

3/day each: tongues, water breathing, water walk

1/day each: conjure &Reference[elemental]{elemental} (water &Reference[elemental]{elemental} only), control water, gaseous form, invisibility, plane shift

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You either create or destroy water.

Create Water. You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range, extinguishing exposed flames in the area.

Destroy Water. You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the &Reference[cube]{cube} increases by 5 feet, for each slot level above 1st.

For the duration, you know if there is an &Reference[aberration]{aberration}, &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or &Reference[undead]{undead} within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of &Reference[poison]{poison} and disease.

This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.
This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface--such as water, &Reference[acid]{acid}, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava--as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.

If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

Special Notes: water elemental only.

You call forth an &Reference[elemental]{elemental} servant. Choose an area of air, earth, &Reference[fire]{fire}, or water that fills a 10-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range. An &Reference[elemental]{elemental} of challenge rating 5 or lower appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. For example, a &Reference[fire]{fire} &Reference[elemental]{elemental} emerges from a bonfire, and an earth &Reference[elemental]{elemental} rises up from the ground. The &Reference[elemental]{elemental} disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The &Reference[elemental]{elemental} is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, which has its own turns. It obeys any &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your &Reference[concentration]{concentration} is broken, the &Reference[elemental]{elemental} doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled &Reference[elemental]{elemental} can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

The GM has the elemental's statistics. Sample elementals can be found below.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

Sample Elementals

CR Creature Name
1/4 Steam Mephit
1/2 Dust Mephit, Ice Mephit, Magma Mephit, Magmin
2 Azer, Gargoyle
5 Air &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, Earth &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, &Reference[fire]{Fire} &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, Salamander, Water &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, Xorn
6 &Reference[invisible]{Invisible} Stalker

Until the spell ends, you control any freestanding water inside an area you choose that is a &Reference[cube]{cube} up to 100 feet on a side. You can choose from any of the following effects when you cast this spell. As an action on your turn, you can repeat the same effect or choose a different one.

Flood. You cause the water level of all standing water in the area to rise by as much as 20 feet. If the area includes a shore, the flooding water spills over onto dry land.

If you choose an area in a large body of water, you instead create a 20-foot tall wave that travels from one side of the area to the other and then crashes down. Any Huge or smaller vehicles in the wave's path are carried with it to the other side. Any Huge or smaller vehicles struck by the wave have a 25 percent chance of capsizing.

The water level remains elevated until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. If this effect produced a wave, the wave repeats on the start of your next turn while the flood effect lasts.

Part Water. You cause water in the area to move apart and create a trench. The trench extends across the spell's area, and the separated water forms a wall to either side. The trench remains until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. The water then slowly fills in the trench over the course of the next round until the normal water level is restored.

Redirect Flow. You cause flowing water in the area to move in a direction you choose, even if the water has to flow over obstacles, up walls, or in other unlikely directions. The water in the area moves as you direct it, but once it moves beyond the spell's area, it resumes its flow based on the terrain conditions. The water continues to move in the direction you chose until the spell ends or you choose a different effect.

Whirlpool. This effect requires a body of water at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep. You cause a whirlpool to form in the center of the area. The whirlpool forms a vortex that is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 50 feet wide at the top, and 25 feet tall. Any creature or object in the water and within 25 feet of the vortex is pulled 10 feet toward it. A creature can swim away from the vortex by making a &Reference[str]{Strength} (&Reference[ath]{Athletics}) check against your spell save DC.

When a creature enters the vortex for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and is caught in the vortex until the spell ends. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, and isn't caught in the vortex. A creature caught in the vortex can use its action to try to swim away from the vortex as described above, but has disadvantage on the &Reference[str]{Strength} (&Reference[ath]{Athletics}) check to do so.

The first time each turn that an object enters the vortex, the object takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage; this damage occurs each round it remains in the vortex.

You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on &Reference[str]{Strength}, &Reference[dex]{Dexterity}, and &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when &Reference[stunned]{stunned} or otherwise &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.

A creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire} or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination. If you are trying to reach the City of Brass, for example, you might arrive in its Street of Steel, before its Gate of Ashes, or looking at the city from across the Sea of &Reference[fire]{Fire}, at the GM's discretion.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

You can use this spell to banish an unwilling creature to another plane. Choose a creature within your reach and make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature must make a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw. If the creature fails this save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.
